author: Deleted User
content: someone called "John" on the call posted something into the chat in response to my explanations about "think blocks" and transaction urgency, it was something like "compact blocks did not work very well for low latencies". And I did not have time to ask what John meant. I now wonder how to find him to ask about it

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <jadler> ü§î (re @eth1x_bridge_bot: <Alexey> someone called "John" on the call posted something into the chat in response to my explanations about "think blocks" and transaction urgency, it was something like "compact blocks did not work very well for low latencies". And I did not have time to ask what John meant. I now wonder how to find him to ask about it)

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <jadler> Don't quote me on this, but from what I've read, Compact Blocks and the like don't work well with low blocktimes (which is what we have with Ethereum) since mempools are comparatively more decorrelated.

author: Deleted User
content: Ah, that is what I thought you mean - low blocktimes

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <jadler> I used "latency" imprecisely, sorry about that. It's the short blocktimes that are more precisely the issue.
